abstract: Hillary Clinton delivers speech at Old State Capitol in Springfield, Ill, site of Abraham Lincoln's historic 1858 speech on 'house divided,' in which she excoriates Donald Trump and says he represents threat to country's democracy; also acknowledges that she has contributed to partisanship dividing nation.

headline.print_headline: Clinton, at Site of Lincoln Speech, Bemoans the Current Republicans
headline.main: Hillary Clinton, at Site of Lincoln Speech, Laments G.O.P.’s Turn to Donald Trump

keywords.value: Dallas, Tex, Shooting of Police Officers (2016)
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Trying to present herself as an agent of harmony, Mrs. Clinton also admitted that she had “sometimes fueled the partisanship that stands in the way of progress.”...
lead_paragraph: Trying to present herself as an agent of harmony, Mrs. Clinton also admitted that she had “sometimes fueled the partisanship that stands in the way of progress.”
